justification: “Accordingly, we developed the Anticipated Food Scarcity Scale (AFSS) to capture perceptions of food resources becoming less available in the future,” indicating that the AFSS is the instrument created to measure the AFS construct.

measured_by: Mini-K (short version of the Arizona Life History Battery)
justification: “The life-history strategy was measured with the Mini-K, which is a short, 20-item version of the Arizona Life History Battery,” explicitly pairs the construct with its measure.

“We measured one personality dimension from the HEXACO-60 short personality inventory… The participants responded to the 10-item measure of emotionality,” showing Emotionality is assessed via the HEXACO-60.

“To assess the discriminant validity of the AFSS, we used the Food Insecurity Experience Scale developed by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations,” linking food insecurity to the FIES.

measured_by: Radimer/Cornell Measure of Hunger and Food Insecurity
justification: “Another scale that we applied to assess the discriminant validity was the Radimer/Cornell Measure of Hunger and Food Insecurity,” specifying this instrument for the construct.
“The 8-item Generalized Sense of Power Scale was used to test the prediction that people who believe that they can wield power over others…,” indicating the scale operationalises sense of power.
“The 29-item Locus of Control Scale… measures the external versus internal locus of control among participants,” directly tying construct to measure.

“Positive and negative affect was captured on a 20-item (10 for positive and 10 for negative affect) Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS),” identifying PANAS as the measure for positive affect.
The same PANAS description notes that the 10 negative-affect items quantify the negative affect construct.

measured_by: Short form of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
justification: “We measured anxiety using a six-item short-form of the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory,” linking the STAI short form to the anxiety construct.
Later studies report affect “as measured through the 10-item short version of the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (I-PANAS-SF),” showing this short form gauges positive affect.
The same I-PANAS-SF description states that five items measure negative affect, confirming the instrument for this construct.
